thread.title: Houses selling faster and for higher prices in 2017 in Washtenaw County
thread.title_full: Houses selling faster and for higher prices in 2017 in Washtenaw County

author: Lauren Slagter | lslagter@mlive.com
title: Houses selling faster and for higher prices in 2017 in Washtenaw County

organizations.name: ann arbor area board of realtors

text:
Houses selling faster and for higher prices in 2017 in Washtenaw County Real Estate Sign A real estate sign sits outside of a home in Ann Arbor on Wednesday, February 22, 2017. (Hunter Dyke | The Ann Arbor News) comments 
ANN ARBOR, MI - Houses in Washtenaw County are selling faster and at higher average prices so far in 2017 compared to this time last year. 
Overall, the housing market in January looked very similar to the market at the start of 2016, according to a press release from the Ann Arbor Area Board of Realtors. There were 259 new listings for residential houses in January, compared to 256 a year ago, and 192 single-family homes sold compared to 191 in January 2016. 
The most notable difference is that the average sale price in January was $271,131, a 5.6-percent increase compared to the same time last year. Also, houses sold last month were on the market for an average of 60 days, while houses that sold in January 2016 were on the market an average of 70 days. 
Overall, 2016 brought a 6.1 percent drop in the number of single-family home listings compared to 2015, but the median sale price increased by 5.7 percent to $243,000. Ann Arbor had the highest average sales price in Washtenaw County at $391,802, and Ypsilanti had the lowest average sale price at $156,606. 
The number of new listings peaked in May 2016, and the highest average sales prices came in July. Tigers spring training
